title: What Is a Minecraft Exit Code? 9 Common Crash Errors & Fixes

steps.title: Exit Code 1 is caused by outdated drivers or incompatible mods.
steps.content: Exit Code 1 is caused by outdated drivers or incompatible mods. To fix this error code, do the following: Update your graphics driver . Double-check your Minecraft mods and remove any that are new, broken, or incompatible.

steps.title: Exit Code 139 appears when you're using an outdated operating system.
steps.content: Exit Code 139 appears when you're using an outdated operating system. This usually appears on older Mac devices, such as Mac OSX 10.5.8 or older. Upgrade your device to make sure it meets Minecraft's minimum requirements . [1] X Research source Update the Minecraft client.

steps.title: Uninstall "D3Dgear" to fix this Exit Code error.
steps.content: Uninstall "D3Dgear" to fix this Exit Code error. Exit Code -1073740777 usually occurs if the "D3Dgear" application is running on your computer. This application is used for game recording and live streaming. You'll need to completely uninstall this program from your computer to fix this error.

steps.title: Update your graphics drivers.
steps.content: Update your graphics drivers. Exit Code -1073741819 is usually caused by outdated drivers, but it can also be caused by having the "D3Dgear" application installed on your computer. If you still get the error code after updating your graphics drivers, uninstall the "D3Dgear" application.

steps.title: Exit Code -805306369 occurs when your computer is out of memory.
steps.content: Exit Code -805306369 occurs when your computer is out of memory. The RAM (Random Access Memory) on your computer is required to function properly. When you don't have enough memory, the game will crash. If you can't upgrade your PC, close all background applications while Minecraft is open. In some cases, this error can be caused by an outdated Java client. Download the native launcher from the Minecraft website . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Reinstall Java to fix Exit Code 134.
steps.content: Reinstall Java to fix Exit Code 134. You may see a file named "hs_error_pid" in your Minecraft folder or desktop. If you see this file, you'll need to reinstall Java from the official website.

steps.title: This Exit Code is caused by a corrupted registry.
steps.content: This Exit Code is caused by a corrupted registry. Your Java installation may have been interrupted, or you may have used a corrupted setup file. To fix Exit Code -2147483645, reinstall Java on your device.

steps.title: Reinstall Minecraft to fix Exit Code 225.
steps.content: Reinstall Minecraft to fix Exit Code 225. This Exit Code can be caused by an error in Minecraft's settings. You'll need to reinstall the entire game and any mods to fix it.

steps.title: Turn VBO off in Minecraft.
steps.content: Turn VBO off in Minecraft. If you can get into the game, open Options , Video Settings , and then turn off VBO.
